content.detailedDescription:
At 11:25  pm on 07/22/09.  i witnessed a star like shape that was 3x brighter than venus.
 i was out to my patio after hearing a number of fireworks.
 
after looking at the fireworks i gazed at the skyline looking east and little south at about 30 degrees off the horizon. the object was not moving. i went inside to grab my field glasses. after looking for several minutes and not finding them i went back to observing. the object had moved slightly. it was in the direction of the city of bellevue wa. i face lake washington, living in the sand point area.

watching for another several minutes the object started to fade in strength and dim to a red color. then it disappeared altogether for 10 seconds, returning to full strength again.

this pattern repeated  three times, moving slightly on the horizon in south direction.

cloud cover stopped my observation. total time of event was 30 minutes. 11:25 pm to 11:55pm 07/22/09.
content.summary: Bright star-like object fading to dim red, then disappearing and reappearing. repeated three times.

content.detailedDescription: On monday night july 19 around 10:49pm i heard a loud noise coming from the woods in my back  yard. this noise was unlike anything i have ever heard befor. i went to my back sliding door and began looking out the screen thinking to my self this is very unusual. then the lights appeared from the woods. the object seemed to rise from out of nowhere. then the object began to move and the sound became increasingly louder and louder. this sound it was making is very hard to explain. the best way to explain it is like very low digital frequency but without vibration like a jet would cause. the lights were in a triangle formation with a super bright red light in the center of the triangle. the lights at each point of the triangle were bright white light at a downward facing direction. these lights including the red light did not emit glare or shine like normal lights do at night. the lights looked unnatural. not man made lights. this triangle was no more than 2000 feet above the ground and moved at an alarmingly slow pace. conventional air craft such as planes and jets can not fly this slow without stalling and crashing. commercial jets do not fly this low in my area anyways. the closest airport is 20 miles away. the triangle did not have any blinking lights such as planes have. planes and jets have green and red lights that blink to let others know if they are approaching or going away. boats have these same lights. i had my girlfriend come out side to view this object. she was in absolute disbelief at what we were seeing. i told her to grab the camera and take a picture. the picture is very poor quality as many ufo pictures are. we watched this object for 2 to 3 minutes befor it disappeared along with the noise. i then texted my friend who lives a quarter mile down the street and asked him if he had seen the object. he replied he was listening to his radio in his room and this loud noise completely drowned out his radio. i have seen this object 3 times befor with now a total of 4 other people now. the first 3 times were all in 2000 and 2001. all these sightings were in within 10 miles of each other. two days later i went outside to snap a couple pictures of the area we had taken the first picture at so i could get a good refrence point in good light. i took two pictures right after each other without noticing anything at the time. i went inside to view the pictures and realized i had caught something on camera which i can not explain.
content.summary: 3 bright white lights in triangle formation

content.detailedDescription: At 11:42 pm 7/17/2009, my neighbor knocked on my door. it was unusual because it was really late so i thought it was an emergency.  she said "sorry to bother you so late, but my husband is in the back yard looking at some weird lights in the sky and thought you might want to see them too."  i then said "ok, i'm out back right now."  i then opened up my sliding glass door to go to the lanai and i looked up in the eastern sky at about 45 degrees, or the 1 o'clock position, and saw a triangular object in the sky moving from left to right and back left and up and down and it surely didn't look like anything i've ever seen in my life.  i then ran back into the house to wake up my wife, who is the biggest ufo skeptic that i know, and said "wake up! wake up! you've got to come outside and see this thing!!" she said "no, i've to go to sleep, i have to work in the morning!" i preceded to say "you have to see this thing in the sky, just trust me, you have to come out and see this!"  i then looked for our camera, a casio exilim 10.1 mega pixel camera, and went back outside with my dog and started recording footage of this thing in the sky.  i walked over to my neighbors house and we, three of us, watched this thing for 2 and a half hours.  my neighbor had binoculars and a telescope, but it was easier to use the binoculars to see the silohuette of this object.  it was moving in different patterns, but generally stayed in the eastern sky moving from left to right in a pendulum type pattern, but it would also moved westward a little bit, but still remained at the 1 o'clock to 1:30 position in the sky.  if you held a dime towards the sky, the size was a little smaller than the dime. it seemed to be about 1000-3000 feet in the sky hovering over i-75 near sr 54.  the feelings i felt was "what the heck is that?"  we sat on some chairs and watched this thing for a couple hours.  i started to feel really sleepy so i went back inside the house to go to sleep, but i kept checking out my window because i wanted to see where this thing will go once it's done hovering over wesley chapel, fl. i found my other battery that was fully charged so i went back outside for a few more minutes and fimed one more video.  i don't know what we saw, but it wasn't a plane.  matter of fact, we saw 2 planes fly by that night, one was flying from east to southwest.  we heard the sounds of the engines as it came closer to us and as it flew past us.  the sounds were evident even when the plane seemed to be further to us than the triangular object in the sky.  the next plane fly past us from south to north and you could also hear it as it flew past us.  but this object made no sounds at all.  the night sky was very clear and there was no or very little wind that night.
content.summary: It was a 3 pointed triangle with 3 lights on each corner and a 4th light was on the bottom. general shape - upside down pyramid but with only 3 sides

content.detailedDescription: i stepped out onto back porch and observed what looked to be a ball of fire with a blueish pulsing halo. the object looked like it was on fire,not trailing flame,the surface moved and swirled around giving the look of a fire but contained within the circular shape. it appeared to be about 1/2 mile north, lower than the overcast,which was about 2 to 3000 ft. at first i thought, an airplane or helicopter on fire, but it moved very slowly and was not descending, appearing to stay at the same altitude. as a pilot and former aircraft owner, with an avid interest in anything aviation related,i knew this was something out of the ordinary. no navigation or landing lights, no sound. about 1/2 the size of a dime at arms length. after watching for 30 sec. or so and it coming ever closer and increasing in size( due to getting closer) i called sue out to see it. we then went to the upper deck and watched it for another 1/2 min. or so, sue called miranda,leslie and a visiting friend to come out to see it. the object then made a slow turn to the west, and moved off in that direction. it appeared to climb into the cloud layer and faded as it ascended. i have witnessed other strange lights in the sky through the years but nothing so close ,clear and obviously not a type of conventional aircraft. i went through all the possibilities i could think of and can tell you what it wasn't but have no idea what it was.
content.summary: fireball like, w/ blue halo,pulsing, slowly moving south then turn to west,under overcast sky

content.detailedDescription:
I was coming home from work amd noticed what looked like lighting in the sky but had a deep red glow to it. as the onject got closer i noticed it was a hugh triangle that covered my whole apartment complex which is about 1 mile in either direction.It had a dark grey shinny metallic sufaces.It made me feel sick to my stomach, i dont know if it was just nerves or what, but i was shaking. as it got closer i noticed it was about 2 stories thick with a deep red glow coming fron the center at the bottom, with electrical discharges from the rear sparks in you will. the air felt electric like static electricty. it moved so quickly without a sound except for the snaping sounds of the discharges at the rear. i wached it from a dot in the sky and it went right overhead and disappered in about 15min. i could'nt sleep that night and my body has a static charge, anything i touched there was a spark, very weird i have never experinced anything like it in my life. i had a camera in my house but was frozen and could not move to get it. i wish i would of it was so clear just moving in the sky. it was just amazing and i am noe truly a beliver. could it have been miltary? i just have never seen anything close to that in the sky. it was almost felt like i reach out an touch it. i still have a very strange feeling inside and having problems sleeping. 

tony 
new london, ct
content.summary: Large triagle 1mile each side emitting electrical discharges red glow

content.detailedDescription:
My husband and son were taking out the trash at 11 pm est on july 18, 2009.  my son (15 yr old) came running into the house to tell myself and my daughter (13 yr old) that there were ufos and to come look.  we didn't believe him and thought they were going to jump out and scare us since it was dark so we didn't go right away.  my son came running back in within a few minutes telling us to come look, seriously there were ufo's.  then my husband came inside and said we really needed to see this.  all 4 of us stood on our front steps looking north toward cr 6.  there were 4 orange lights in the sky in a kind of zig-zag shape.  some of the lights were stationary and some were moving really slowy up in the sky.  they were far enough away that we had no idea the shape of the object giving off the light.  they just looked like orage balls in the sky.  they were maybe, from our location, about an inch big and only a few inches apart.  so, i don't know how far away they actually were, or their actual size.  that is just what it looked like to us.  as we were watching the lights, the upper most light just suddenly disappeared.  then the remaining lights eventually moved up in the sky (one by one - not all at once - and some did remain stationary as others moved) and disappeared.  as one disappeared another one would appear below the others.  in total, my husband saw 7 lights.  i witnessed 4 when i first stepped onto the porch and a 5th one appeared before i watched them all individually disappear.

we tried taking pictures with my digital camera but they did not turn out.

this was the strangest thing i have ever seen.  i don't know if they were planes? but to us they were ufo's simply because we didn't know what they could be.  i'm not claiming i witnessed a ufo from outerspace filled with "grays" or anything.  just that we saw strange orange lights in the sky that none of us could explain.

we have looked toward the sky in the same direction at the same time since then and have not witnessed it again.  it was very neat but scared my daughter.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Orange lights in the sky

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were lying in bed watching a movie. we decided to step out onto our backyard for a cigarette. we went outside at about 4:15am. the sky was mostly clear and could see many stars. i noticed a bright light over head and to the right of us in the north eastern direction. at first i thought it was a star and asked my girlfriend if it was the northern star because it was so bright. she said she wasn't sure and pointed out another group of stars and said it was the little dipper. i then pointed out a group of stars that i thought looked like a kite, she agreed. then my attention focused back on the very bright light that hadn't moved. i noticed it was much to close and bright to be a star. that's when it began to interest me. i focused on the light and noticed that it was slightly moving but not much. it was very bright and had little rays of light coming out of it like a light shinning into a diamond. i lit up another cigarette and watched the light. it would stay in the same area but move a tiny bit and would dim a bit, then grow brighter. it seemed like it was moving back and forth. i had to keep moving in order to keep it in view from the trees in the neighboring yards. it seemed to be several hundred feet in the air. after 3 cigarettes and about  20 minutes it began to dim and move further away, headed in the north eastern direction. another cigarette and 10 minutes went by before it faded to a smaller sized light, a little bigger than the other stars i had been looking at earlier. it then began climbing higher into the sky heading strait up. it climbed until it vanished into the clouds high in atmosphere.  the time it finally vanished was 4:48am pst. i have never seen anything like it. i felt overwhelmed, and memorized at the same time. i was very interested in watching it because i have never seen anything remotely similar in what i was whitnessing. there is no way it was an aircraft i have ever seen, and it definitely was moving under its own power. i am not sure what it was but i swear by what i saw and my girlfriend was there and saw it as well. i also called a friend during the sighting and told him to look in the sky. he said he saw a bright light but was not sure if it was the same thing i was seeing. i was unable to take any photos because all i had was my iphone and it was unable to see it, but there must be others who saw it. it as over a pretty populated area. i feel that it was significant enough to try and call any ufo sighting hot line i could on www.Google.Com at the moment, call the observatory, and wright this detailed description of my experience.  i am an educated college student who is known for being very credible by many many people. please take this seriously and look into. please contact me with your findings, i am very interested. this is not a joke! thank you for your time and effort looking into this sighting. i am very curious in finding out what i saw so please find me an answer. thanks!
content.summary: Went outside and noticed a bright light in the air. it remained there for about 30 minutes slowly moving around and then dimmed up and into the sky.

content.detailedDescription: On july 22 2009 on my back porch i was looking up in the sky i noticed a bright non pulsating or flashing light. from the start it was about a quarter inch in size, then as it moved west to east it started to get smaller and dimmer, then vanished in about 7 seconds. i look to the sky often and know satellites this was not one.At first i thought it was a plane but the lights did not flash and with no cloud cover i should have seen it for longer than i did.
content.summary: Disappearing light

content.detailedDescription:
Between approx. 9pm to 1020 pm a friend and i were sitting on the front porch of my home at hot springs sd when i noticed a star-like object moving across the sky west to east.  the object appeared to be very high in the sky and moved at varying speeds and would change direction irratically and in an instant. after about 30 seconds the object dissappeared. approx. 15 min. later another object appeared in approx. the same place as the first traverling north to south, remained visible for 30 to 35 seconds exibiting the same characteristics as the first.  approx. 10 mins. later a third object appeared in the same location in the sky flew in a east to west direction with the same movements and altitude as the other two.  then at approx. 7 mins.Later another object appeared flew north to south and then seemed to dissappear as the others had. when i say dissappeared i mean that all of a sudden they were no longer visiable.  there were four objects in all untill we went inside for the night.  because my friend smokes and i will not allow it in the house we were again out on the poarch wed. the 22nd of july 2009 at approx 9:30pm when another object appeared in the sky this one was consiserably lower in altitude was star-like. when it first appeared. it was fairly large flying east to west in a fairly straight line at what appeared to be a moderate speed. as it proceeded across the sky it began to get dimmer untill it finally disappeared into the night sky. about 3 mins. later another object appeared in the sky at about the same altitude and speed in a north to south direction and exibited the same pattern as the first. none of these objects blinked off and on they just appeared brightly and slowley faded from view.  when they disappeared they seemed to fade get bright and then go out altogether.  none of the objects disappeared over the horizen they just went out. because we went back inside we didn't see any more objects that night.  these did not appear to be aircraft. there were aircraft both nights so we were able to distinguish between the two. in 2007 in dec.On three consecitive nights i obsereve objects that appeared as the two of 22 july only i watched all of these untill they dissapeared over the horizen.  i was an aircraft mechanic in the air force so i know the differance between airplanes and ufos.  thank you,
                                        ron holtry
content.summary: 4 star-like objects flying at high alt. and at great speed then slow down etc.

content.detailedDescription:
my wife had gotten up to prepair for the work day. upon going outside to get something out of her vehicle, she had noticed one of our trash bags had been torn into by animals sometime in the previous evening. as she gathered the mess she stoped due to a sound. she described the sound as that of a consistent steady,"hum". the sound was enough to grab her attention and realize this was not a common event, something outside our everyday environmental surrounding sounds. this continued for the duration of her 5 mins. or so outside.

   she moved through the rest of her morning gathered our two young girls in her vehicle and continued the slow drive out of our road. as she hit the main road and through a few, twists, hills, and slopes she had come upon long straight away. it was here where the strange morning was reminded and continued. she said that infront of her some distance up in the sky was a stationary metallic sphere. she observed this for just a few moments, the time the road and direction would let her, but more than enough time to take in the sight and give plenty of thought. due to the bizzare sound and then bizzare visual of the metallic sphere and the close time in proximity of the two events, she has connected the two together. the event in total time from sound,(hum), to sight,(metallic sphere), was within 20 mins.
content.summary: A consistent , "hum & buzz", followed by a visual of a; "metallic sphere".

content.detailedDescription:
1. on tue 07/21/09 22:28 (clear night sky) i called my two daughters out to our melvindale, mi backyard to view a white star sized orb moving ene to ese (elv 70 deg to 110 deg) lasting 20 sec maximum.

2. during sighting #1 above one daughter exclaimed look dad: directly above (elv 80 deg to 100 deg) we saw a v shaped formation of white stubby flying wings or boomerangs facing n - total ~ six with one behind the apex near the formation's center.  the boomerangs were bright and slightly beige with a darker outline.  my daughter stated that at first sight the boomerang outlines were red. the formation was ~ 6" wide and 3" deep with each boomerang ~ the size of a sea gull at 200'.  the formation moved behind a tree and disappeared after ~ 5-7 sec in view total (according to my daughter)!

3. then a large star sized orb (dime at arms length) moved w to e (elv 45 deg to 135 deg) ~ 20 sec and faded out.  i called one daughter back outside to witness this also.

4. next we (one daughter and i) saw another white star sized orb moving due e (elv 90 deg to 135 deg) ~ 10 sec before it also faded out.  the time was now 22:39.

we then went inside to check spaceweather.Com for satellite flybys for (42.3 lat., -83.2 long.): iss 10:31:50 pm wnw 10:34:13 51��� 
note that sighting #3 was too short of duration to match the iss flyby.

5. i then went again to the backyard at 23:09 and saw a white star sized orb moving ene to ese (80 deg to 135 deg) which sped up before fading out ~ 10 sec (one daughter also witnessed)

6. finally, at 23:11 my two daughters called me to view a large orange/white star sized orb (elv 45 deg) moving n to e that faded out after ~ 5 sec.  one daughter stated that the orb at first sight blinked two red lights then remained a steady color of orange / white.

for sightings #4-#6 some light clouds drifted in but did not affect our views.
content.summary: Three witnesses viewed five orbs and a v formation of flying wings in a span of 42 minutes.

content.detailedDescription: I live in palm beach county and my front porch faces lake osborne which would be facing west. i was talking on my cell phone to a friend and first noticed it when i saw green shining from behind a tree which was blocking my vision. i kept moving to get a better view but it was moving east towards my direction anyway. when it moved to the point i could see all of it what i saw was definitly an object and it was glowing green in light. the movements were not that fast, it was moving at a sideways/forward motion and then it stopped moving and hovered over the john prince park campground. i watched the object that was shapped like a football without the points at the end for many minutes. my friend was still on the phone as i watched to see if it would move again and couldn't even speak while i watched entranced. the green lights seemed to get even brighter than before and after that i just felt fear and went into my house. in the following minutes i continued to look out my window, and perhaps the first three minutes i was in my house the object still remained hovered across the lake, then one time i looked and it was just gone. the whole time i heard no noise for it hovering pretty close.
content.summary: Ufo was green and moved slowly with a few moments of hovering. no noise maybe a few hundred feet off the ground

content.detailedDescription: I stepped outside to take out the trash.  i looked up as i normally do to see anything out of the ordinary.  tonight there was something unusual about one heavenly body.  the object in question was very bright.  too bright to be a star or even a planet.  althought, saturn would be the closest comparison to what i saw.  however, it was not in the correct position to be a planet and it was moving ese.  from straight up in the night, slightly west to the ese, steady pace until the end when it appeared to have slowed down a bit.  then when it had traversed 25 degrees of the sky in less than 1 minute it slowed down and got dimmer and dimmer until it complete disapear from the place from which it appeared to have stopped.  as if it was not moving ese anymore but instead moved straight away from me and its final position.  when it appeared to be moving away from me it was as if the light was not just turned off but instead it looked as if it was the same light just exponetially further away until it could no longer be seen in the chicago night sky. very bright object with no blinking aviation lights, no sound althought it appeared to be very high in altitude.  no distinguishable shape other than that created by the round appearanece of the white light.  brilliantly white!  by far the most luminous object in tonights sky for 45 seconds.  i want to call my wife to see it but we have a narrow view of the sky due to buildings and therefore a short viewing time and i didnt want to miss anything by taking my eyes off of it.
content.summary: Saturn like, bright white, no aviation lights, moves at steady clip, slows, dims, disapears from sky!

content.detailedDescription:
Tonight my wife and i were taking a walk in our neighborhood.  we were walking to the north down our street.  several miles to the north, we had a lot of summer heat lighting taking place, no thunder.  when the lighting hit, it lit the clouds up with a nice purple color.  very beautiful.

i looked up to the west in crystal clear sky.  overhead, my wife and i saw a very bright light.  at first i thought it was an airplane.  it looked exactly like a star, only much larger and brighter.  it was flying in a straight path, and was silent.  the object was flying smooth as silk, almost seemed like it was gliding.  no engine noise was heard at all.  the brightness was very intense, but did not light up any of the neighborhood.  the light did not blink or flicker, but stayed constantly light.  the object also seemed to be flying at a very slow rate of speed, and did not change altitude.  compared to the altitudes that you typically see a low flying passenger plane, this felt lower.  it flew directly overhead, but no object could be made out, just light.  it was extremely easy to track and watch it.

my wife and i turned around back towards our home so we could keep watching the object.  we followed it as we walked past three houses.  at the third house, our view was blocked by two trees.  based on the speed and altitude it was flying, we should have been easily able to see the object once we were past the trees.  however, the object was simply gone without a trace.  whether the light simply turned off, or it shot off in the distance, we will never know.  the experience was incredible, but we felt a little scared as well when we saw it.  i only wish i didn't let it go behind those trees.  we live in a newly developed area, and have hardly any trees at all.  we should have been able to see it.
content.summary: Ufo looked like a very bright star, flew straight, altitude lower than low-flying planes, and silent.

content.detailedDescription: We were in greentown watching the fireworks display on july 4th. the time was approx 9:45 pm.  we were headed north on a road that we aren't sure what it was as we are not that familiar with greentown.  we noticed a large, low, orange light hanging stationary in the ne sky.  (ne of greentown) then it began to move slowly from nw to se in the sky.  it was definately not a part of the fireworks.  we continued to watch it until we couldn't see it anymore due to our driving and its moving away from us
content.summary: Orange ball of light moves slowly toward the nw from se

content.detailedDescription: I was travelling south on dixon road and at about 600 n in tipton countym i witnessed three white lights in a triangular pattern hovering just a few feeto ffo the ground over a field.  i could see that the lights were attached to a larger, triangular craft.  the lights/craft moved forward a few feet, then back, then forward again and then shot straight up and away fast.  i had pulled off the side of the road to watch, for approximately 5 minutes.  about 2 minutes after the lights/craft left, 5 choppers arrived at the area and went in the direction of the craft.  they all had spotlights on.  the weather was clear and warm.
content.summary: 3 white lights hover over field, move erratic and then are followed by choppers

content.detailedDescription: I was driving southboung on us 31 and was almost at sharpsville.  west of us 31 i noticed three red lights low in the sky appreaing to hover about 10 to 15 feet above an open cornfield.  i could see that they were all connected, attached to a larger, dark triangular shaped object.  i wathced it for as far as i could see is as i continued on southbound.
content.summary: Three red  balls of light that were attached to a dark triangular craft

content.detailedDescription: While out driving around sightseeing and whatnot with my wife on 7/21/09 northwest of ft collins, just west of the tiny town of bellvue, i stopped and took several pictures of the somewhat rare greenery of the foothills due to the abundant rain this year. i noticed a commercial airliner contrail headed wsw while taking the picture but paid it no attention. when we got home i popped the camera card into the computer to tweak the light and contrast levels when i noticed a black dot on one of the pics that was facing west towards the foothills. i zoomed in and noticed a black oval. i dismissed the possibility of it being a bird or plane because as you can see in the attached pics, the camera picked up cloud details nearby that are actually smaller than the object. to me this indicates that at that level of magnification, wings would be seen if it was a plane or bird. additionally, if it was a blur of a bird in flight, there still would be areas of lighter or darker shades where light would reflect off wing, head, leg or abdomen surfaces no matter how blurred it may be. there appears to be none of these as the object shows a consistent dark shade. there does however appear to be an area of lighter shade along the top of the object, possibly implying sunlight reflecting off the top surface. no other objects were noticed in any of the remaining pics and no other strange effects or events were noticed at the time. i did not zoom in further in the supplied pics because any detail would just be lost in enlarged pixels.
content.summary: Oval shape in sky discovered in pic nw of ft collins

content.detailedDescription:
I went outside to let the dogs go to the bathroom.  i looked up and saw a very bright light that at first i thought was a plane, but it wasn't moving away or in a straight line.  it seemed to be hovering.  it was flashing lights white, blue, and red.  they seemed to light up in succession along the length of it.  

it stayed in the same position in the sky for 20 minutes or so, then seemed to begin to very slowly move closer to the horizon, getting smaller, moving towards the west.

at times the object seemed to sort of quickly slide to the left or right, or up and down.  it sort of "jiggled" where it was in the sky.

at one point, a white light the size of a star suddenly appeared off to the side of it and then disappeared only a split second later.

i went and got my wife out of bed who easily saw it and both of us exclaimed how it didn't look or move like a plane.  my neighbors were awake in their backyard, i called them up, they came over (we could see it better without the trees in their own backyard) and they all saw it too.  there was agreement that it seemed to move from side to side a bit and that at first it seemed like a plane, but it wasn't moving away as quickly as a plane would, and seemed to move back and forth from time to time.

occasionally when it jumped or seemed to move more obviously, i exclaimed out loud how weird it was and "what the heck is that?".  i tried to film it, but i couldn't find a mini-dv tape, and the 2mp digital camera i had couldn't seem to locate it in the sky.  i'm hoping it happens again, i have a tape ready now.
content.summary: Wobbly multiple light emitting object seemed to hover and slowly move off to the west

content.detailedDescription:
On the night of 15 july 2009, my father and i were sitting out by a fire on sagamore beach, approximately 150 feet west of the sandwich town line.. electrical storms and rain were in the area. strong thuderstorms had passed to the south, and other thunderstorms were to the west, east, and north over cape cod bay. we were sitting by a fire on the beach, and the fire was relatively low . the tide had gone most of the way out. we were possibly the only vacationers on the beach at the time because the rain had been fairly heavy at times (we stayed out because we were under waterproof beach umbrellas). my father told me to look towards the water beause he saw something. two blue lights seemed to dance on the water from right ot left, and they traveled fast. ther was no observable engine noise. they seemed to be over the water so its possible that we were seeing one glowing object and its reflection below it. if that were the case than it seemed as though it might have been "skippoing" off the water like a stone. it was probably about as bight as a storebought flashlight. the object seemed to follow the shore. when it got far to the left i lost sight of it. a few minutes later i looked for footprints down by the water, even though the objects seemed to be going much faster than a human could have, and found none.

i made the following estimations that night, and recorded them on my cell phone. distance was 200 yds, water was 100yds away. the lights traveled from right to left in ~10 seconds.The traversed 120degrees of my field of view. if i were looking straight out toward the water, it was from 60 deg to my right, all the way to 60deg to my left.  i feel these numbers are probably high. reducing the numbers is more conservative anyway, so i will use the following: distance to the water:65ft. closest approach of object occued at about 100 yds away from the fire, straight out in the direction of the water. it probably took about 8 seconds to travel through 120deg of view from my location.

using two right triangles, with h being the 100yds closest approach distance in the center and two 60deg angles on either side, the object traversed about 346 yards in 8 seconds. (tan(60)*(100yds)*2).  that translates to 88mph. this speed is consistant with the visual observation. it looked like it was going at least highway speeds. using my origonal estimates gives the object a speed of about 142mph. again, there was no engine noise of any kind. 

we were truly baffled by the sighting and the only possible explination we could think of was that perhaps it was some form of heat lightning or st. elmo's fire or something, but those are definitly not satisfying. i'd also like to note that i am an aerospace engineer and i received my bs in 2008. we saw what we saw and have no explination for it, but any explination would be most welcomed and greatly appreciated.
content.summary: Two blue lights traveling northwest along the water at sagamore beach. spotted from the beach at about 100 yds away over the water (perhaps 1 light  +its reflection?).

content.detailedDescription: We were stadin in my driveway looking up @ the sky and i noticed a bright light out of place then began to watch it as it moved from sw to ne toward the town of kenova. i know what satalites look like and this was no satillite
content.summary: Bright lit object flying across the sky

content.detailedDescription: I look at mufon.Com everyday and i always see peoples finding by just finding something in their photos after taking pictures of something, so i thought i would try it and hopefully catch something at random and i did,it was taken on a clear sunny day,  i dont know what it is but it is very high in the sky, round, and spherical, and it also looks like it may have been moving in the picture. my first possible ufo picture. i will continue to take more pictures and hopefully get more in my pictures.
content.summary: Took two pictures at random and found something in one photo

content.detailedDescription: I had just arrived at a back yard gathering at a friends house on the evening of july 18, 2009. as i was greeting others and introducing some friends i brought i noticed a bright orange orb about 1/3 the size of the moon moving across the night sky a fair distance away.  it was traveling rather fast and had absolutely no blinking lights required to identify itself as a plane or helicopter. it was heading in a westerly direction and i kept my eye on it for about a minute before other people began to notice it.  as more and more people began to question what it was the object suddenly came to a complete stop in the sky and floated there for about another minute before becoming noticeably dimmer and dimmer and eventually faded away completely in front of mine and about 30 others eyes.
content.summary: Orange ball silently moved across the night sky at a fairly fast pace before coming to a complete hault and then slowly became smaller and smaller until it disappeared completely.

content.detailedDescription: Last night my girlfriend and i went out to our backyard in julian, ca to look at the stars as it was a really clear and beautiful night.  as we looked up at the starts we noticed one of the stars moving across the sky at a very hight rate of speed.  it looked like all the other stars, the same size and color except it was moving across the sky very fast, we watched it for about 2-3 minutes until it disappeared.  it definately was not a shooting star.  i was wondering if anyone else reported seeing it or if julian has alot of sightings in general?
content.summary: Ufo sighting in julian ca - outside san diego

content.detailedDescription: I was outside cooking on the grill and i finished up around eleven it felt so good i decided to eat outside so i was setting outside my house a��� about eleven thirty i noticed a very very bright light too bright to be a star and to large to be a star so i thought must just be a helicopter but it was too low for it not to be herd i'm meen this thing was only about 500 foot of the ground then the craziest thing happens the light goes out and a dimmer green light turned on and this thing zipped across the sky it was extremely fast faster than anything i have ever seen i was baffeled i stood there like a statue for at least a half hour i was confused and terrified
content.summary: Silver boomerang shaped one bright light a the point of bomerang light dies down and object shor though the sky

content.detailedDescription:
My mother in law(sharon), her boyfriend(steve), my wife(melissa), and myself were sitting outside around a camp fire at their cabin. melissa had just gotten up to go inside, and use the bathroom. steve looked up, and happened to comment that the stars were more visible now that it was later in the night. the time was approx. 23:00-23:30 est. as soon as he commented on the stars, sharon, and i looked up. just then what looked to be a shooting star became visible. but it definitely wasn't. 

the light was much brighter than any star in the sky. it was about as bright as a planet when they are visible to the naked eye. there was no tail. it was moving as fast as shooting stars i've seen in the past. the light was solid, not blinking. there was no engine noise. no sonic boom. no noise at all. the light was initially traveling along the horizon in the east sky heading north. it dropped 90 degrees, and got very bright. it appeared to be headed right for us. it dropped for approx. 1-2 seconds, then changed course to its original direction of travel until it disappeared in the distance. it was not the space shuttle. i've seen it before from the ground with binoculars. my initial thought was something skimmed the atmosphere, then plunged quickly straight through it, and then continued on its original course.


my wife came back outside just after the sighting. we told her what happened, and then we all watched the sky. several minutes later the object came back from the w heading ene. it was just as bright, but moving much slower. it appeared to be wobbling slightly side to side. again, no noise, no tail. we watched it until it disappeared out of sight. that was the last time we saw it.

the cabin is near camp grayling. i live right by selfridge air national guard base. i know what planes in the sky look like. i know what shooting stars look like. i know what planets look like. i know what the space shuttle looks like. this was something else.
content.summary: Looked like very bright shooting star, then dropped straight down, got really really bright, then changed back to original direction

content.detailedDescription: I was snapping pictures of the sun and its reflection off the water. i did not see the object untill i sent the photo to my e-mail
content.summary: I did not see the object ,it appeared on the photograph

content.detailedDescription:
I was taking photographs at an intersection in louisville, colorado of a fire truck. i take about 275 photos on the way home from work each day and usually about the same amount on the way to work. i had the sunroof open and while stopped simply put my arm through the sunroof and started taking pictures. i was going to delete the photos after looking at them and upon finding a roundish object in the distance i decide to keep all four for reference. the photo taken immediately before this photo was taken at 15:44:02 and seven seconds later at 15:44:09 this object appeared in the next photo submitted. enlarged it appears to be directly over the low buildings seen in the distance.
i did not see this object. i was only taking photographs hoping something would show up and as usually i was not surprised to find something. since i take on average 7000 photos a week i will always get something interesting. 

the first photo is original, the second enlarged with color correction.
content.summary: Sitting at stoplight taking photos of a fire truck, i took four photos each from 2-7 seconds apart and the object appears in the last photo

content.detailedDescription:
I woke up in bed and had my blinds open to get air because it was hot the day before. as i was stretching and waiting to fully wake up i happened to roll over and look out the window. i noticed the regular stars and among them this other flashing object that appeared a little bigger. so i got out of bed and got my binoculars. when they were not strong enough to make out any detail i got my camera with 12x zoom, knowing i can zoom far more on the computer as well. i watched it and took pictures for up to 40 minuets, during which the object meandered about the sky. from my point of view considering scale, it moved about the area over the building out my window. it changed the direction of it's nose and changed colors as well. first moving in a diagonal towards the ground, then up and off to the east. it soon came out of  the field of view of my window. 
i first assumed it to be a helicopter, perhaps performing some service in the desert (as the area it must have been over is semi-desert prairie land which is moderately farmed.)then when i had a better view with my equipment i may have thought it to be a satellite. once all the computer zooming was done i had no choice but to admit i do not know that the flying object it. weather it contains space men or government secrets is also up for debate.
i did not feel afraid or anything but i was very curious and exited at the possibility of recording a ufo.
content.summary: A small obgect, possibly disc or oval shaped, flashing diffrent colors, moved around slightly.

content.detailedDescription: Went out to check weather and look at stars as i usually do at approx 245am looked up and noticed section of sky totally dark. don't know what happened next, woke up in bed 12 hrs later? then i noticed marks in patteren on inner right are, still their, please contact, worried!                                                                                   .                                                                           .                                                                       .                                                                           .                                                                       .     marks seem to be burned in?
content.summary: Sky blacked out and loss of time and physical evidence
